Subject: [TRUB] Oktoberfest beer
Content-Type: text/plain
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

(I sent this out just before the list moved and I don't think it 
made it out)

Fellow brewers,

Just the other night I had an Oktoberfest tasting at my house.
We sampled the following:

Lowenbrau Oktoberfest            6.1% ABV, 13.7 Plato
Hofbrauhaus Oktoberfest          5.7% ABV, 13 Plato
Augustiner Oktoberfest           6.0% ABV
Paulaner Oktoberfest             6.0% ABV
Spaten Oktoberfest               5.9% ABV
Carboy/Trub/Tomcat Oktoberfest (thanks Kevin Vaughn)

Some of the interesting points were the difference between what the
sytle guides recommended and what I actually bought from the stores.

Typically, the sytle guides say the beer should be somewhere from
amber to copper to brown.  All the German Oktoberfests where, at the
absolute most, amber with Spaten Oktoberfest (supposedly based on the
original style (closer to a Vienna)) being the closest to a slightly 
dark amber.

Another difference from the sytle guides was they claimed it should
have a toasted malt aroma and flavor.  Again, the only one of the 
German beers with a slightly toasted flavor was the Spaten.

They were quite bitter but the hops flavor being quite hidden.  I
think they all used the same hops (Hallertauer I think).

As for drinkability, I prefered the Tomcat.  It also appeared closer
to the style than any of the real German ones...

Does anybody have the vital statistics or recipe of this beer? 

Thanks,
Tony
